column4: how do i use the nouveau driver instead of the nvidia one that doesn't work as of now?
disable the nvidia driver in 'Additional drivers'
there's no nvidia driver there. that's the problem in the first place
there's some problem with nvidia and their driver for the current x server version as i understood
So you are probably using the nouveau driver. You can check that typing 'lsmod |grep nouveau' in a console.
btw, on the live cd (usb for me) it did run the nouveau driver and it did get listed with lsmod
it's not listed with lsmod. hmm maybe it's because my laptop falls back to the regular graphics card?
regular would be intel? in that case 'lsmod |grep i915'

yes, that's the one. so my ubuntu falls back to the intel card after it cannot find the nvidia one? wait a sec. maybe i need to remove all the other nvidia packages that i don't know how got installed in the first place
ok, something happened, i got the nice effects i had on the live usb like that beautiful alt-tab window, but lsmod still shows i915 and no nouveau
Well I guess the intel GPU is a Intel GMA HD, used in the first intel iX series. They are running quiet good with linux.

so ubuntu is now using the intel graphics card, and not the nvidia one. will i feel anything differnet if i use the nvidia with the nouveau? for now i only need simple eyecandy effects for the desktop, no 3d games or whatever (at least for now before nvidia releases the nice cat)
No. You will be ok with the intel GPU. It works quiet well.
